notes: Deload/maintenance literature supports lower volume phases; RIR/velocity papers support using high effort as a proxy when sets are few; fasting meta‑analysis shows strength maintenance is possible in deficit contexts.
RIR scales and RIR–velocity relationships inform monitoring; coach planning survey provides context for how practitioners prioritize effort/quality.

caveats: These works discuss periodization and load organization more than strict set‑volume dose response; they contextualize why higher volumes may be used outside deficits.
